meanings.definition: A mound or hill, especially one made artificially.
meanings.sent1: The children played on the small mottes in the park.
meanings.sent2: The workers built mottes to protect the castle.
meanings.sent3: The animals thought the mottes were giant playgrounds.
meanings.sent4: The mottes stood like ancient guardians of the land.
meanings.sent5: The mottes loomed large against the horizon.

meanings.definition: A small piece of wood used in a game of dice.
meanings.sent1: Roll the dice and see if you get the lucky mottes!
meanings.sent2: He picked up the mottes and shook them in his hand.
meanings.sent3: The mottes rolled across the table, bringing cheers from the players.
meanings.sent4: The mottes clattered on the wooden surface, signaling the start of the game.
meanings.sent5: The shiny mottes gleamed under the dim light of the room.

meanings.definition: A clump of trees or bushes.
meanings.sent1: The forest was filled with mottes of various shapes and sizes.
meanings.sent2: Birds nested in the protective cover of the mottes.
meanings.sent3: The travelers rested in the cool shade of the mottes.
meanings.sent4: The mottes whispered secrets to the passing breeze.
meanings.sent5: The colorful leaves painted a beautiful picture within the mottes.
